Welcome to Checkpoint Live! We are an event management Software As A Service (SaaS) that allows for the collection and collaition of logs from checkpoints on web enabled devices such as but not limited to smart phones, tablets, desktop and laptop computers.

Checkpoint Live is provided to you by Adam Chilton sole trader.

The terms stated here govern your use of the service. As used in these Terms of Use, "Checkpoint Live", "the site", "the service", "our service" refers to the service provided by Checkpoint Live for creating and managing events, including all features and functionality, user interfaces as well as content and software associated with our service.

By using the service provided by Checkpoint Live you agree to these conditions. Please read them carefully

Introduction

The following terms, conditions and provisions(the "Terms of Use") govern the relationship between you and Checkpoint Live and its subsidiaries, affiliates and/or related entities ("we" or "our") as it pertains to your online dealings with Checkpoint Live.

The Checkpoint Live Website

By using any part of checkpointlive.com or checkpointlive.co.uk or any mobile websites or applications owned by Checkpoint Live you agree to comply with, and be legally bound by, these Terms of Use, the Privacy Policy (collectively referred to as the "Website Terms"), all applicable laws and all applicable terms of use and policies as may apply to the devices, technology or products used in conjunction with the Website. If the Website Terms are not acceptable to you, you must not use this Website. "Use" of the Website shall include, but is not limited to browsing the Website and the Content, as hereinafter defined, registering for an account on your devices, creating events in Checkpoint Live, requesting electronic newsletters.

1. Modification of the Website Terms

We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to change modify, add or remove portions of the Website Terms at any time with or without notice to you. Please check these Website Terms periodically for changes. Your continued use of the Website after the posting of any changes to these Website Terms constitutes your acceptance of such changes. Modifications to these Website Terms shall be effective as the effective date written above.

2. Account Membership

2.1 Account Types

Checkpoint Live provides you, through the website, the ability to create and register for an account for the purposes of creating an event and utilising the Checkpoint Live service. Users who explicitly sign up using their email address are henceforth referred to as "Event Organiser Users". Event Organiser Users create an event on Checkpoint Live on the behalf of the event and are responsible for the event.

The second type of users do not sign up but are provided log in credentials by the Event Organiser Users, henceforth referred to as "Event Users". These users utilise a username and password to access the event. Checkpoint Live stores no information regarding Event Users except a name or nickname entered for the use of stating who recorded the logged sighting of a participant or team of participants. By entering your name or nickname you agree to allow Checkpoint Live to store that name for the use of the event. Checkpoint Live will NEVER sell or trade or utilise these names outside of the password protected event.

Event Users may be removed with or without notice after the event the username and password corresponds to has concluded.

2.2 Account Holder Age

By registering for an account with checkpointlive.com, you affirm that you are either over the age of 18 and are fully able and competent to enter into the terms, conditions, obligations, affirmations, representations, and warranties set forth in these Website Terms, and to abide by and comply with the Website Terms.

2.3 Account Removal

An account may be removed or disabled at any time with or without notifying the account holder for the following reasons:

  • We have reason to suspect that account details are not true or are inaccurate.
  • The account is not following these terms and conditions.
  • The account is being used for any missconduct including but not limited to bullying.
  • A period of non-use. Generally this would occur after contacting the Event Organiser User but this is not required.

2.4 Account usernames and passwords

2.4.1 To use certain features of your account, you may also need a username and password, which you will create through the registration process. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the password and account, and you are responsible for all activities that occur under your password or account. You agree to notify Checkpoint Live immediately of any unauthorised use of your password or account or any other breach of security, and to ensure that you exit from your account at the end of each session. Checkpoint Live and its respective affiliates, related companies, unaffiliated partners, licensors and/or licensees cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from Checkpoint Live and/or its respective affiliates, related companies, unaffiliated partners, licensors and/or licensees' failure or your failure to protect your password or account information.

2.4.2 The member who creates and purchases the services for is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the username (email address) and password used. This user has additional access to change the event's structure but no payment details are held within Checkpoint Live. Should an unauthorised user use your password or breach security in any way you agree to inform support@checkpointlive.com as soon as you become aware.

3. Billing

3.1 Checkpoint Live is a pay for what you use service. All payments are handled by Stripe and your card information does not come into contact with Checkpoint Live's servers. If Stripe's authentication causes a payment to fail this is not the fault of Checkpoint Live but please try another payment method.

3.2 Checkpoint Live restricts usage within an event until a payment is made. You can skip payment until you wish to pay for the service. You may also add more participants to be tracked by Checkpoint Live or pay for other optional extra features. Once purchased you may later reduce the number of participants or turn off an optional feature however, you will not recieve a refund. If you repeat this process of changing the number of participants tracked you will only pay for the number of participants over and above those previously purchased.

3.3 Checkpoint Live reserves the right to change prices at any time, this will not affect the cost of payments made but might affect future costs for adding participants to be tracked or additional features.

In addition, you agree not to upload, post, e-mail or otherwise send or transmit any material designed to interrupt, destroy or limit the functionality of any computer software or hardware or telecommunications equipment associated with the Checkpoint Live Service, including any software viruses or any other computer code, files or programs. We may terminate or restrict your use of our service if you violate these Terms of Use or are engaged in illegal or fraudulent use of the service.

4.2 You may utilise the copy to excel spreadsheet functionality to take a copy of the data collected with Checkpoint Live.

4.3 The quality of internet service may vary from computer to computer and device by device. This may be affected by a variety of factors, such as your location, the bandwidth available through and/or speed of your Internet. You are responsible for all Internet access charges. Please check with your Internet provider for information on possible Internet data usage charges. Checkpoint Live is not responsible for ensuring that internet is available at the location of the event and will not issue refunds.

5 Cookies and local storage

5.1 Checkpoint Live does not utilise cookies but requires localstorage and web browser databases to perform. When using Checkpoint Live your device will store an offline copy of the logs, this is requrired for continuation of usage if the device goes offline and for syncronisation with the Checkpoint Live Databases. If you have issues with internet connection, connect

5.2 Checkpoint Live makes use of service workers on browsers that have that ability. Therefore Checkpoint Live will make usage when possible of your browser's cache to avoid re-downloading the Checkpoint Live website.
